Issues.Title: BUG: animate.leave doesn't save styles till the end of the transition
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

core

### Is this a regression?

Yes

### Description

When using `animate.leave`, styles are not preserved until the end of the animation.

In the example above, clicking the "Toggle" button should trigger the component's closing animation (using `grid-template-rows`). The animation plays, but the element expands in size. This is likely not the expected behavior

Issues.Title: [Bug/UX] No filename length restriction in Angular Playground - apparently, infinity is the new limit üòÖ
Issues.Body: ### Describe the problem that you experienced While exploring the new [Angular Playground](https://angular.dev/playground), I noticed that the filename field allows *unlimited characters*. It happily accepts absurdly long filenames that exceed the standard filesystem or UI convention limit of **255 characters** the kind that would make even an operating system blush. üòÑ While technically harmless, it‚Äôs a UX and validation gap that could lead to display overflow, layout breakage, or potential storage issues later if persisted ### Enter the URL of the topic with the problem üîó [https://angular.dev/playground](https://angular.dev/playground) ### Describe what you were looking for in the documentation I was testing filename handling and expected some sort of constraint or graceful truncation when exceeding typical filename length limits (commonly 255 chars). Instead, the field just kept accepting input like it was hosting a world record attempt for ‚Äúlongest filename ever typed.‚Äù üèÜ ### Describe the actions that led you to experience the problem 1. Open [Angular Playground](https://angular.dev/playground) 2. Click the **"+"** tab to create a new file 3. Type a *very* long filename (e.g. paste the sample below üëá) 4. Observe that there‚Äôs no validation or limit ‚Äî it just keeps extending endlessly ### Describe what you want to experience that would fix the problem Ideally: - Restrict filename length to a reasonable limit (say 100‚Äì120 characters) - Optionally show a friendly warning like ‚Äúfilename too long‚Äù - Truncate long filenames gracefully in the UI (e.g. `very_long_file_name....ts`) This would align with common UX standards and prevent layout stretching or confusion. üòÖ ### Add a screenshot if that helps illustrate the problem ### If this problem caused an exception or error, please paste it here ```true ``` ### If the problem is browser-specific, please specify the device, OS, browser, and version ```true - **Device:** MacBook - **OS:** macOS Sonoma - **Browser:** Chrome (latest) ``` ### Provide any additional information here in as much as detail as you can ```true Not a major bug, but a fun catch ‚Äî a simple frontend validation rule could keep filenames sane and UIs tidy. Until then, Angular Playground might just be the first IDE to fully embrace the concept of *‚Äúlimitless creativity.‚Äù* üöÄ ```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Bug/UX] No filename length restriction in Angular Playground - apparently, infinity is the new limit üòÖ" (#64320)

Issues.Title: [Patch port] fix(migrations): remove error for no matching files in control flow migration
Issues.Body:
This is a patch port of #64253.

Now that the control flow migration is running as a part of `ng update`, we need to be a bit forgiving about there not being any matching files since it can break the entire update process.

These changes switch the error to a warning and it counts the files for the entire workspace, not the individual projects.

Issues.Title: test: make xvfb start and stop async
Issues.Body:
The `xvfb.start()` and `xvfb.stop()` methods are asynchronous but were being called synchronously. This can lead to race conditions where the tests start running before the virtual frame buffer is fully initialized, or the process exits before it's fully stopped.

This commit promisifies the `start` and `stop` methods to ensure they are properly awaited, making the e2e test setup more robust.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "test: make xvfb start and stop async" (#64310)

Issues.Title: Unhelpful compiler error message when attempting to use pipe in @for's track expression
Issues.Body:
### Command

build, serve, presumably anything else that compiles the application

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

When I attempt to use a pipe in the track expression of a `@for` block, the compiler crashes and emits a very unhelpful error message, saying only "Pipes are not allowed in this context" with little indication of what the context is and no information on where the error is.

### Minimal Reproduction

- Create a new Angular project.
- Use a pipe in a `@for` block's track expression.
- Run `ng build`, `ng serve`, or anything else that compiles the project.

Alternatively, I have a minimal reproduction at https://github.com/Quantaly/ng-track-pipe-error-demo that you can try to build.

### Exception or Error

      at TraitCompiler.compile (file:///home/kai/Code/Discount/track-pipe-error-demo/node_modules/@angular/compiler-cli/bundles/chunk-SZUJOV4Y.js:6276:38)
      at IvyCompilationVisitor.visitClassDeclaration (file:///home/kai/Code/Discount/track-pipe-error-demo/node_modules/@angular/compiler-cli/bundles/chunk-SZUJOV4Y.js:6576:37)

Issues.Title: Several changes to the vscode extension build and release pipeline
Issues.Body:
**build: migrate to in-repo ts_project with strict deps**

This commit migrates the vscode-ng-language-service to use the in-repo `ts_project` macro, which has strict dependency checking enabled. This improves build-time dependency validation and helps ensure that all dependencies are explicitly declared.

As part of this change, redundant `tsconfig.json` files have been removed in favor of a centralized configuration, and `jasmine_test` rules have been updated to the standard macro. A minor code adjustment in `server/src/session.ts` was also made to improve error handling.

---

**build: add @angular/language-server to framework release output**

This change updates the build configuration to include the
@angular/language-server package in the standard framework release
output.

By integrating it into the release train, we ensure that it is versioned and published consistently with the rest of the Angular framework.

---

**build: use @angular/language-service from source**

This commit updates the VSCode Angular Language Service extension to use the `@angular/language-service` package built from source within the workspace, rather than a version downloaded from npm.

This change simplifies development and testing by ensuring the extension always uses the latest code from the local repository. The Bazel build configuration, VSCode launch settings, and e2e tests have been updated to reflect this change.

---

**build: remove unneeded language-service dependency**

The `@angular/language-service` package was not needed for integration tests or benchmarks. Removing this dependency simplifies the build configuration.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Several changes to the vscode extension build and release pipeline " (#64306)

Issues.Title: fix(core): ensure default path is set for control flow migration
Issues.Body:
When running the control flow migration via `ng update`, the path parameter could be undefined. This change ensures a default value of './' is used when no path is explicitly provided, making the migration work consistently between `ng update` and `ng generate` commands.

Fixes #63294

## PR Checklist
Please check if your PR fulfills the following requirements:

- [X] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/contributing-docs/commit-message-guidelines.md
- [ ] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
- [ ] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)


## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

- [X] Bugfix
- [ ] Feature
- [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
- [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
- [ ] Build related changes
- [ ] CI related changes
- [ ] Documentation content changes
- [ ] angular.dev application / infrastructure changes
- [ ] Other... Please describe:


## What is the current behavior?
Issue occurred because ng update doesn't apply schema defaults like ng generate does. This fix handles both cases by explicitly setting default values in the migration code.

Issue Number: #63294 


## What is the new behavior?
This change ensures a default value of './' is used when no path is explicitly provided, making the migration work consistently between ng update and ng generate commands.

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [X] No
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(core): ensure default path is set for control flow migration" (#64298)

Issues.Title: rxResource example typo
Issues.Body: ### Describe the problem that you experienced In the `rxResource` example, `params: () => this.userId()` should be: `params: () => ({ userId: this.userId() })`, since the following line references `params.userId`. --- --- Related attempt to fix this example: https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/63484/files. --- It would also be a good idea to link [this example](https://angular.dev/ecosystem/rxjs-interop#using-rxresource-for-async-data) in https://angular.dev/api/core/rxjs-interop/rxResource, since the API Reference page shows up first when you search for "rxResource" via Ctrl+K, and there are no examples there. --- (I found the `params` syntax a bit verbose BTW; repeating `params` 3 times and `userId` 3 times in this example, unlike `computed(() => ...)` or `httpResource>(() => this.url())`. Not sure if it's possible to simplify though.) ### Enter the URL of the topic with the problem https://angular.dev/ecosystem/rxjs-interop#using-rxresource-for-async-data ### Describe what you were looking for in the documentation How to use `rxResource`. ### Describe the actions that led you to experience the problem Tried to use `rxResource`.

Issues.Title: `@for` control flow doesn't properly recreate components when used inside `ng-content` with `OnPush` change detection
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

core

### Is this a regression?

Yes

### Description

The new Angular `@for` control flow doesn't properly recreate components when the loop is rendered inside `ng-content` of a component that uses `OnPush` change detection strategy. The same scenario works correctly with `*ngFor`.

### Environment

- Angular version: 19.2.4
- Browser: Chrome
- Operating System: MacOS

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a parent component with `OnPush` change detection
2. Create a child component that uses `ng-content` for content projection
3. Inside the projected content, use `@for` with a track function that returns different values
4. Update the data source to trigger the track function to return new values
5. Observe that the components inside the `@for` loop are not recreated

### Expected Behavior

Components inside the `@for` loop should be recreated when the track function returns different values, similar to how `*ngFor` with `trackBy` works.

### Actual Behavior

Components inside the `@for` loop are not recreated, even when the track function returns different values. The track function is called correctly, but Angular doesn't recreate the components.

### Code Example

**Parent Component (OnPush):**
```typescript
@Component({
  selector: 'app-parent',
  template: `
    <app-child [data]="data$ | async">
      @for (item of items; track trackFunction($index, item)) {
        <app-item [data]="item" />
      }
    </app-child>
  `,
  changeDetection: ChangeDetectionStrategy.OnPush
})
export class ParentComponent {
  trackFunction = (index: number, item: any) => `${this.version}-${index}`;
  // ... other code
}
```

**Child Component (uses ng-content):**
```typescript
@Component({
  selector: 'app-child',
  template: `<ng-content />`,
  changeDetection: ChangeDetectionStrategy.OnPush
})
export class ChildComponent {}
```

**Working Alternative with *ngFor:**
```typescript
// This works correctly
<app-child [data]="data$ | async">
  <app-item 
    *ngFor="let item of items; trackBy: trackFunction" 
    [data]="item" 
  />
</app-child>
```

### Additional Context

- The track function is called correctly and returns different values
- The same code works perfectly with `*ngFor` and `trackBy`
- The issue only occurs when the `@for` loop is inside `ng-content` projection
- The issue only occurs when the parent component uses `OnPush` change detection

### Workaround

Use `*ngFor` with `trackBy` instead of `@for` when the loop is inside `ng-content` of an `OnPush` component.

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

https://stackblitz.com/edit/stackblitz-starters-cjrgd5dz

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

```true

```

### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

```true
Angular CLI: 19.2.14
Node: 22.12.0
Package Manager: npm 10.9.0
OS: darwin arm64

Angular: 19.2.14
... animations, cdk, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core
... forms, language-service, material, platform-browser
... platform-browser-dynamic, platform-server, router
... service-worker

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1902.14
@angular-devkit/build-angular   19.2.14
@angular-devkit/core            19.2.14
@angular-devkit/schematics      19.2.14
@angular/fire                   19.1.0
@schematics/angular             19.2.14
ng-packagr                      19.2.2
rxjs                            7.8.1
typescript                      5.5.4
webpack                         5.98.0
zone.js                         0.15.1
```

Issues.Title: BUG: not working animate.enter for ViewContainerRef.CreateComponent
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

core

### Is this a regression?

Yes

### Description

`animate.enter` not working when component is rendered using `ViewContainerRef.createComponent`.

There is 4 seconds animation which should change `opacity` from 0 to 1. Component is displayed immediatelly, no animation performed.

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

https://github.com/kukjevov/animation-bug

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

```true
No exception
```

### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

```true
Angular CLI: 20.3.5
Node: 22.16.0
Package Manager: npm 10.9.2
OS: Windows 11

Angular: 20.3.4
```

### Anything else?

_No response_

Issues.Title: refactor(forms): rename the control directive to the field directive
Issues.Body:
Renames the control directive and the input that users set to bind a
field to a UI control.

Previously users would do:

```
<input [control]="someField">
```

Now users will do:

```
<input [field]="someField">
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor(forms): rename the control directive to the field directive" (#64300)

Issues.Title: ng extract-i18n crashes when consuming a library that uses $localize
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug? localize ### Is this a regression? Yes ### Description After upgrading to Angular 20, we're seeing `ng extract-i18n` fail. We are consuming components from 3rd party packages created with ng-packagr (same Angular version) and those components use `$localize` in their typescript files. ### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug https://github.com/daiscog/angular-20-extract-i18n-issue ### Please provide the exception or error you saw ```true [error] TypeError: Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'startOfLinePositions') at MessageExtractor.getOriginalLocation (file:///.../node_modules/@angular/localize/tools/bundles/chunk-TZHZOBVD.js:183:41) ... ``` ### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`) ```true Angular CLI: 20.3.5 Node: 20.19.0 Package Manager: npm 10.8.2 OS: darwin arm64 Angular: 20.3.4 ... common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms, localize ... platform-browser, router Package Version ------------------------------------ @angular-devkit/architect 0.2003.5 @angular-devkit/core 20.3.5 @angular-devkit/schematics 20.3.5 @angular/build 20.3.5 @angular/cli 20.3.5 @schematics/angular 20.3.5 rxjs 7.8.2 typescript 5.9.3 zone.js 0.15.1 ``` ### Anything else? Previously reported in angular/angular#63528, although nothing to do with nx. The minimal example above contains an example 3rd party package (installed from a local .tgz file) which contains the following component: ```ts @Component({ selector: 'lib-foo', template: `

{{foo}}

`, }) export class Foo { readonly foo = $localize`:message@@foo-works:Foo works!`; } ``` This is exported via the main `index.ts` file. The lib was built using `ng-packagr` and `npm pack` ran in the result to create the .tgz file, which is then installed in the example repo. I've monkey-patched `node_modules/@angular/localize/tools/bundles/chunk-TZHZOBVD.js` with the following immediately before the line where the error was thrown: ```js if (!originalSourceFile) { console.log('Looking for ' + originalStart.file); console.log(originalStart.file, location); process.exit(1); } ``` ...and that logs this (paths snipped for brevity): ``` Looking for .../example/libs/foo/src/lib/foo/foo.ts .../example/libs/foo/src/lib/foo/foo.ts { start: { line: 36527, column: 17 }, end: { line: 36527, column: 49 }, file: '.../example/main-D7LCOSUQ.js', text: '`:message@@foo-works:Foo works!`' } ``` Note that there is no such file as `libs/foo/src/lib/foo/foo.ts` in this project - this is actually the relative path to the file in the 3rd party lib project that was packaged with ng-packagr.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "ng extract-i18n crashes when consuming a library that uses $localize" (#31431)

Issues.Title: @angular/build:unit-test: Launching ng test --include with Windows path fails
Issues.Body:
### Command

test

### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

This issue is specific to Windows and launching ng test with a specific file. Vitest is configured as the test runner.

1. Building tests works but running tests fails with the error: "No test files found." if you launch ng test with a Windows path:
```
ng test --browsers Chromium --include "C:\client\src\app\header\header.component.spec.ts"
```

2. Building and running tests work if you launch ng test with a quasi-POSIX path on Windows:
```
ng test --browsers Chromium --include "C:/client/src/app/header/header.component.spec.ts"
```

3. Building tests fails if you launch ng test with a full POSIX path on Windows:
```
ng test --browsers Chromium --include "/c/client/src/app/header/header.component.spec.ts"
```

Since the native Windows path is not working, you can't use ${file} in launch.json of Visual Studio Code. Similarly, the full POSIX path ${command:extension.commandvariable.file.filePosix}" is not working either. This prevents the launching of the current test file on Windows.


### Minimal Reproduction

Reproduced with 21.0.0-next.7

```

Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "build: update dependency bazel to v7.6.2 (20.3.x)" (#31425)

Issues.Title: build: improve source map configuration for better debugging
Issues.Body:
This commit refactors the jasmine_test rule in tools/defaults.bzl to use the centralized version from @devinfra//bazel/jasmine:jasmine.bzl. This simplifies the rule by removing manual source-map-support handling.

Source map generation has been standardized across the project by enabling the sourceMap option in the root tsconfig.json and removing conflicting inline source map settings from test-specific configurations.

These changes significantly improve the developer experience by enabling breakpoints to be set directly within TypeScript source files when debugging tests in editors like VSCode.

Issues.Body:
### Command

serve

### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

Currently playwright sends `Accept: */*` header, and receive 404 error. I reopened #12613, since it is still relevant.

### Minimal Reproduction

Run playwright test, that loading angular dev server page.

```typescript
it('test', async ({page}) => {
  await page.goTo('http://localhost:4200');
});
```

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>pnpm/pnpm (pnpm)</summary>

### [`v10.18.1`](https://redirect.github.com/pnpm/pnpm/blob/HEAD/pnpm/CHANGELOG.md#10181)

[Compare Source](https://redirect.github.com/pnpm/pnpm/compare/v10.18.0...v10.18.1)

##### Patch Changes

- Don't print a warning, when `--lockfile-only` is used [#​8320](https://redirect.github.com/pnpm/pnpm/issues/8320).
- `pnpm setup` creates a command shim to the pnpm executable. This is needed to be able to run `pnpm self-update` on Windows [#​5700](https://redirect.github.com/pnpm/pnpm/issues/5700).
- When using pnpm catalogs and running a normal `pnpm install`, pnpm produced false positive warnings for "*skip adding to the default catalog because it already exists*". This warning now only prints when using `pnpm add --save-catalog` as originally intended.

</details>

Issues.Title: feat(cdkDrag): Restrict drag movement by individual boundary sides (top, right, bottom, left)
Issues.Body: ### Feature Description **Description:** Introduce a configuration option for `cdkDrag` that allows developers to restrict dragging beyond specific sides of a boundary container. This would enable more nuanced control than the current `cdkDragBoundary`, which enforces containment uniformly on all sides. **Proposed API (example):** ### Use Case **1. MatDialog Handle Visibility Constraint** Enable users to drag a MatDialog freely within a grid layout, but restrict movement beyond the top and left/right edges of the viewport to ensure the dialog‚Äôs drag handle remains visible and accessible. This prevents scenarios where users accidentally drag the dialog off-screen, making it difficult or impossible to reposition without refreshing the page or resetting the layout. - Preserves usability by keeping the drag handle within reach. - Prevents frustration from dialogs becoming ‚Äúlost‚Äù off-screen. - Supports responsive design by adapting to dynamic viewport sizes. **2. Dashboard Layout Editors** Allow users to drag widgets freely within a grid but prevent them from overlapping fixed headers or sidebars. For example: - Restrict dragging above the top edge to preserve a sticky toolbar. - Allow overflow on the bottom for expandable panels. **3. Mobile UI Builders** In mobile layout editors, you might want to: - Prevent dragging past the left/right edges to maintain responsive design. - Allow vertical overflow for scrollable content zones. **4. Game Interfaces** In drag-based puzzle or strategy games: - Restrict dragging outside the playfield on specific sides (e.g., prevent dragging off the top to simulate gravity). - Allow dragging into inventory zones only from certain directions. **5. Design Tools (e.g., Canva-style editors)** Enable asymmetric drag zones: - Prevent dragging elements off the canvas on the left and top (to preserve alignment). - Allow overflow on the right for snapping to guides or external panels. **6. Workflow Builders / Flowchart Editors** When building visual workflows: - Restrict dragging nodes above the top boundary to avoid overlapping with global controls. - Allow dragging below for expanding the flow. **7. Accessibility-Driven Interfaces** For users with motor impairments: - Restrict dragging to safe zones to prevent accidental loss of visibility. - Customize side restrictions based on user preferences or device orientation.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "feat(cdkDrag): Restrict drag movement by individual boundary sides (top, right, bottom, left)" (#32044)

Issues.Title: bug(Timepicker): Timepicker issue with FormControl binding
Issues.Body: ### Is this a regression? - [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version ### The previous version in which this bug was not present was _No response_ ### Description When a Timepicker is integrated with a Datepicker and is bound to a formControl instead of property the time does not re-render to display Midnight when the date is changed , as opposed to when it is bound to a property. If the user then saves the record the date saved is at midnight not the displayed time in the Timepicker. ### Reproduction StackBlitz link: Steps to reproduce: 1. [Stackblitz Example Code](https://stackblitz.com/edit/stackblitz-starters-rt5ffl8o?file=src%2Fmain.ts) 2. The Stackblitz project will open with 2 Date and Timepickers defaulted to the current date and time. 3. When you change the date using the Datepicker the Timepicker does not re-render to display the updated time of midnight, when it is bound to a formControl. The second Datepicker and Timepicker is bound to a property and does re-render the Timepicker. ### Expected Behavior When the Date is changed using the Datepicker the associated Timepicker shoud re-render to display the updated time to be midnight as when it is bound to a property. ### Actual Behavior The Timepicker remains unchanged when the Datepicker is updated and does not reflect the time of the associated new date selected. ### Environment Angular CLI: 20.0.0 Node: 20.19.1 Package Manager: npm 10.8.2 OS: linux x64 Angular: 20.0.0 ... animations, build, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core ... forms, material, material-date-fns-adapter, platform-browser ... router Package Version ------------------------------------------------------ @angular-devkit/architect 0.2000.0 @angular-devkit/core 20.0.0 @angular-devkit/schematics 20.0.0 @schematics/angular 20.0.0 rxjs 7.8.2 typescript 5.8.2 zone.js 0.15.0
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "bug(Timepicker): Timepicker issue with FormControl binding" (#32036)

Issues.Title: Screen reader is not announcing label name for section present under stepper variants in Windows.
Issues.Body: ### Is this a regression? - [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version ### The previous version in which this bug was not present was _No response_ ### Description **User Impact:** Visually impaired users who rely on screen readers will be impacted if Screen reader is not announcing label name for section present under stepper variants in Windows. They won‚Äôt know which section they are in, leading to confusion and difficulty completing tasks. ### Reproduction URL: https://material.angular.dev/components/stepper/overview **Steps to reproduce:** 1. Enable NVDA and open the URL: https://material.angular.dev/components/stepper/overview in edge browser. 2. Landing page will get open. 3. Press tab key to reach to the sections present under 'Stepper Variants'. 4. Observe whether screen reader is announcing label name for section present under stepper variants in Windows or not. ### Expected Behavior Screen reader should announce the label name for section present under stepper variants in Windows. ### Actual Behavior Screen reader is not announcing label name for section present under stepper variants in Windows. **Refer Attachment:** Screen reader is not announcing label name for section present under stepper variants in Windows.png Screen reader is not announcing label name for section present under stepper variants in Windows.mp4 https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/9e5ee684-4563-444b-8f76-0c69297de5fc ### Environment OS: Windows 11 25H2 (OS Build 26200.6584) Browser: Edge (Version 140.0.3485.94) Angular 20.x. Material: 20.2.7 Screen Reader: NVDA (2025.2), JAWS (2025.2508.120), Narrator URL: https://material.angular.dev/components/stepper/overview
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Screen reader is not announcing label name for section present under stepper variants in Windows." (#32037)

Issues.Title: docs: migrate to signals and takeUntilDestroyed
Issues.Body:
- Replace lifecycle hooks with constructor initialization
- Convert properties to signals (items, section, _categoryListSummary)
- Use takeUntilDestroyed() for automatic cleanup
- Replace async/await with switchMap to prevent race conditions
- Remove manual subscription management

Benefits: Better performance, automatic cleanup, safer async handling
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "docs: migrate to signals and takeUntilDestroyed" (#32033)
